attributes.action: Compulsory yearly test for secondary school teachers in their respective subject
attributes.background: Secondary school teachers that teach GCSE or A-Level classes should take the respective test in their subject every year and score very highly to ensure that the teaching standards are adequate throughout the nations' schools.
attributes.additional_details: If students are to perform well at school they should be taught by teachers that have throughout knowledge of the curriculum. It would also ensure equality as a student should not be at a disadvantage to their peers if they have a teacher who is not able to teach the curriculum to a satisfactory standard. Failure of the teacher to score highly on the tests they are teaching to should result in intervention and perhaps further training.

attributes.action: I would like to see the regulation of Management Agencies for new build flats
attributes.background: I pay a managing agent a large fee for my new build flat. The managing agent has destroyed our sinking fund and charged us an obscene amount for 'changing bulbs' - They have no one to answer to! Millions of homeowners have to succumb to these agencies who are ever increasing service charges.

attributes.action: Make legal, business's over a certain size MUST pay double time on bank holidays
attributes.background: To make it a legal right that business's over a certain size MUST pay double time for bank holidays.

attributes.action: Make the UK safer place from terrorism.
attributes.background: Allow non uniform police and HM Forces personnel aswell as ex services to be allowed to carry a short barrel weapon assuming they have passed all annual training directives (A.D.T).Terrorism is now becoming the number one subject in our daily lives,people are constantly under threat.
attributes.additional_details: An observation made this week by myself whilst walking through a main line London tube station showed our only defence in London "The Metropolitan Police" looking at the ground constantly whilst on patrol. Is London safe? Who knows when terrorism may occur the main question is are we ready to defend our selfs and others?

attributes.action: Ban the use of opinion polls in the run up to elections and referenda.
attributes.background: Opinion polls have become tools for influencing people's voting decisions and should be completely banned.
attributes.additional_details: The 2015 General Election was badly affected by them and so will the EU referendum.

attributes.action: Make dog ownership require certified training and registered accountability.
attributes.background: Dogs are potentially dangerous animals whose behaviour should be governed appropriately. Handler training equips owners with skills and techniques needed to ensure safe standards of behaviour. Recognised registration of ownership of an animal would give traceable and enforceable accountability.

attributes.action: Remove the Value Added Tax charged on toilet rolls and make them VAT Exempt.
attributes.background: Value Added Tax is currently charged by HM Treasury on the sale of toilet rolls at the rate of 20%. I believe that this should be abolished as they are not "non-essential, luxury items" and are an essential item as are female hygeine products which are rated at 5%.

attributes.action: The £829,000 should be written off by the MOD.
attributes.background: Around a decade ago army pilots were paid retention bonuses. This amounted to £829,000 in total. Some of these bonuses were overpaid due to an administrative error. It costs around £3.6 million to train an Apache helicopter pilot. Losing pilots due to low morale and persecution is not worth the cost
attributes.additional_details: Around a decade ago Army pilots were overpaid retention bonuses due to an administrative error. These overpayments amounted to £829,000 in total. It costs about £3.6m to train an Apache pilot.  At least 15 pilots have already resigned over the action being taken by the MOD. The MOD should just write this error off and stop pursuing the individual pilots.

attributes.action: We believe the Government should increase fuel duty to protect PIP payments.
attributes.background:
In this year's Budget, the Chancellor made changes to PIP.
The role of Government is to protect the most vulnerable.
By cutting PIP payments, the Government is taking away a vital source of income to those who need it the most.
We believe fuel duty should be increased by 2p a litre to protect PIP

attributes.action: Set up housing for veterans before they leave the armed forces.
attributes.background: Each year many veterans come out of the armed forces homeless. This means that veterans are living on the streets. In 2013 it was calculated that 9,000 ex-service personnel were found homeless. Ex-service personnel are becoming homeless and it is on the rise.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/9000-ex-service-personnel-homeless-after-2071049

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-13983279 

These are links of news articles of ex-service personnel being homeless.

attributes.action: Introduce nutrition, the law and tax system in to the primary curriculum
attributes.background:
Many people don't appear to have enough understanding of nutrition, law and taxes.
With introducing or further implimenting these subjects in to the classroom we can help combat the increasing health epidemic, reduce overall debt, and help reduce the chances of incarceration from an early age.

attributes.action: Deport Foreign Criminals Earlier Increase ERS Scheme Time from 9 to 18 months
attributes.background: A Foreign Criminal cost the same as a Uk Criminal Depending on the Prison a Prisoner cost the tax payers up to 33,000 pounds and year , deporting a foreign criminal early to there home country up to 18 months before their sentence expires will save huge amounts of money
attributes.additional_details: there is over 10,000 foreign criminals in uk prisons , giving them enough time off as an incentive will help them in there decision whether to stay and fight to remain or voluntarily request to be removed. Most criminals will jump at the opportunity to be sent back to there home country 18 months early rather than the 9 months already in place under the ERs scheme with the home office

attributes.action: Ask Saudi government to stop executing young innocent people
attributes.background: Saudi government has arrested 17 years old innocent Ali Nammer . Now the family has been threatened that they will execute him in next 24 hours . We request to put pressure on Saudi authorities to cancel their decision and release them

attributes.action: End the supply of alcoholic drinks to MP's / Peers in the Palace of Westminster.
attributes.background:
MP's and Peers are able to purchase alcoholic drinks at a subsidized price at bars in the palace of Westminster costing the tax payer over £4million per year.
As a place of work Westminster should be kept dry with provision of food and soft drinks only. our MPs should vote with a clear head.

attributes.action: Have a set minimum wage of at least £8.50 per hour for care/support workers.
attributes.background: The amount some care/support workers earn is outrageous considering the things they have to endure each day. Care is an absolute must in the community but struggle to find staff purely because of lack of wages.

attributes.action: Impose a ban on leaving your engine running whilst your vehicle is parked.
attributes.background: 9000 people a year in London are killed annually by pollution, about 4million worldwide and that number is rising.
attributes.additional_details:
People often sit in their cars for many minutes with the engine on, I suppose so they can keep the heating on too, or the radio, without running down the battery.
It should be standard to keep a blanket in your car for such occurrences. Parking outside someone's house and belching poison into the occupant's atmosphere should be considered akin to grievous bodily harm.

attributes.action: Review air quality in all airline planes cabins and cockpits-aerotoxic syndrome
attributes.background: Cabin air quality is a very serious health and safety issue which needs to be reviewed by the government in which to make certain of the passengers safety on board aircraft.. This is so that they're is evidence for traces of oil fumes in the cabin air from the engines. Which is deadly and can kill.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence for this is toxicology reports from high class doctors examining organs for traces of engine oil. Reports in many newspapers have stated that it is a serious matter and has killed before. You are unable to know whether that the air is contaminated with the naked eye so passengers are unaware. This can have worse effects on different people. A review needs to be conducted on traces of fumes in the cabin during flight. Filters should be installed to prevent particles getting in.

attributes.action: Stop the increment of car insurance premium with "No Blame" accidents.
attributes.background: Lot of insurance companies increasing the insurance premium of the drivers who were involved in "no blame " accidents. Many driver got hit from behind by another driver while on stall position and ended up paying 30% extra insurance premium during their next renewal. This is unfair for many drivers.
attributes.additional_details: Many people around the UK paying extra car insurance premium just for getting involved in an accident, despite it wasn't their fault at all. I have been hit by a speeding vehicle while waiting in the traffic light and my insurance now gone up by 110%. I spoke to many people around the country and they are suffering from the same fate. This is very fraudulent behavior of the insurance companies to form out money from both parties with any excuse. "No blame" accident sufferers should not pay extra

attributes.action: Introduce a Financial Transaction Tax, use revenue to help fight austerity cuts
attributes.background: A Financial Transaction Tax is designed to stabilise market volatility by acting as a disincentive to short term risky financial transactions, such as high frequency trading. These financial transactions were a leading cause of the global financial crisis. Impose an FTT to stabilise the economy.
attributes.additional_details: The financial crisis caused massive socio-economic human rights violations through austerity measures. An FTT would promote less risky, long term investments which lead to a stronger and more stable economy that benefits all and not just the City. Use the generated tax revenue - European Commission estimate £8bn for the UK - to help fight back cuts to the public sector.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to advertise e-cigarettes on television.
attributes.background: Smoking has long been proven to be dangerous to the people who smoke cigarettes and all the people around them. E-cigarettes has given a rise to new young smokers with the chemical involved being just as dangerous but are still being advertised on telly during the day while children can watch.
attributes.additional_details: Electronic cigarettes are a popular new tobacco product that have still largely unknown public and individual health effects. We should be seriously concerned about the potential health consequences of e-cigarettes. This need becomes more urgent as it becomes more popular among children and young teenagers. We must stop apdvertisement of e-cigarettes before this problem grows.

attributes.action: Make people who claim benefits do  voluntary work/work alongside local council
attributes.background: If people who claim benefits are able to work then they should be made to do something for their money. Why should they sit at home and get money when people go out and work hard and long days for their money? Why should they get it just handed to them and get the easy life without working?
attributes.additional_details: There are plenty of employed who go out there and earn a living why cant people on benefits do something for their money? They don't have time to come in and sit there doing nothing. There routine is get up go to work come in have tea go to bed. The employed don't have time to sit and spend time to themselves because they work for what they have.

attributes.action: Change the NLA guidelines to allow mobile workers to be paid for travel.
attributes.background: In September 2015 the CJEU ruled that the time spent by mobile workers - that is, those who have no fixed place of work - travelling between home and their first and last place of work each day counts as 'working time' under the WTD and WTR. However payment for these hours is down to national law.
attributes.additional_details: National law in this case is the NLA formely the National Minimum Wage which states that travel time between home and a place of work is excluded from the obligation to pay the NMW, including for mobile workers. This is unfair and mind boggling considering that a court has ruled that travel time under the WTD and WTR that safeguard workers to make sure they have regulated breaks and rest periods as work but does not govern pay for these hours. I therefore would like this to be addressed.

attributes.action: Make all cyclists responsible for their actions on public roads!
attributes.background:
Why isn't there any compulsory training for cyclists, why isn't there a way of identifying a cyclist?

We want dangerous cyclists off the road!

Help us promote safe cycling!
attributes.additional_details:
Some of these links will explain what we are trying to deal with:

www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3131256/Has-got-death-wish-Incredible-dashcam-footage-shows-idiot-cyclist-riding-no-hands-busy-London-streets-s-busy-TEXTING.html 

www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/fatal-crashes-are-cyclists-fault-says-boris-7786179.html 

www.leicestermercury.co.uk/Cyclists-fault/story-27759929-detail/story.html

attributes.action: Give the vote to all children over the age of 11
attributes.background: I want children to be able to decide what country is being molded for them as at the moment they have to simply sit back and watch their country fall apart politically and quietly resign. We need a voice as at the moment we are gagged, unable to decide what "our" country needs.
attributes.additional_details: Petition Formed By Sebastian Rumfitt, aged 13

attributes.action: Ensure HIV treatment and support services receive the funding they need
attributes.background: HIV treatment and support services are vital for those who rely on them and for the wider public health of society. In the context of cuts to public health budgets, the Government must make provision to ensure that the integral role HIV services play is protected.

attributes.action: Give More benefits and income allowance for single parents In higher education
attributes.background: Single parent families are not given enough support or income to gain qualifications for highly paid employment to surpport their children and make a better and secure future for them selves and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
Maintenance grants replaced with Maintenon loans 
Denied housing benefit if return to full time higher education 
Lack of support for child care

attributes.action: Give agency staff permanent contracts by law after 6 months with same company
attributes.background: Agency workers are used by companies as a disposable resource. Yes not all staff want to stay with the same company, but the majority do. All agency workers want is a permanent contract, fair working wage, and conditions after 6 months working for a company that clearly needs them. No exceptions!
attributes.additional_details:
I currently work for a company through an agency in the North East UK.
I have been told on numerous occasions, that
"the company" has stated that NO ONE will be given permanent contracts for my job description, only certain departments offer contracts and that is EXTREMELY rare. 
Many of the staff on my department have worked with this company for over 2 years and are STILL being told by bosses things like "if you don't come in this Saturday (voluntary overtime) we'll just replace you"

attributes.action: Amend handgun commandments that illegalize pistol firearms.
attributes.background: I want licensed gun owners to able own pistols as I find it strange how the government allows for the use of shotguns and hunting rifles, however, neglects the use of a smaller, less powerful, and  considerably cheaper firearm to purchase in comparison to a shotgun that can be very expensive

attributes.action: Make video recording of hearings in Courts and Employment Tribunals mandatory.
attributes.background: At present, litigants-in-person and certain groups receive hostile and unfair treatment in Courts and Tribunals. Employment tribunals do not record proceedings. Voice recordings in Courts are edited before being released. The system makes perjury possible and perversity in decisions unchallengeable.

attributes.action: Invest in a single nuclear deterrent with USA, France & Europe and stop Trident
attributes.background: A nuclear deterrent is an insurance policy or safety net you hope will never be used. The world just needs one safety net. We should join the Americans, French and Europeans and invest in a common nuclear deterrent for the democratic world saving billions and not build our own exclusive safety net.
attributes.additional_details:
This arises from an idea in the book Diagonal Lengths: Rethinking our world, (page 121) of a common body taking on the role to defend against Nuclear aggression, thereby saving individual countries from each having to invest in and develop their own nuclear deterrents.

With Trident due to cost £30 Bn, why don't we invest £10Bn into a common shared project with the US, France and rest of Europe to build a single nuclear deterrent and use the £20 Bn we save on other uses -NHS, Education, Research

attributes.action: Make our Road Tax and Fuel Tax get spent on the roads and not other things!
attributes.background:
Our roads are getting much worse and action needs to be taken. They are becoming dangerous and causing damage to our vehicles.
We pay tax on our fuel and we pay road tax which should be used to replace and repair the roads but isn't all spent on the roads which is appalling. 
LETS TAKE ACTION NOW

attributes.action: To allow the wife of veteran of ex-soldier Andrew McLaughlin, to live in the UK.
attributes.background: Andrew McLaughlin has an American wife and a 2-year old daughter and they have been denied entry into the UK because of the Government's strict laws on the rights of non-EU spouses.
attributes.additional_details: Andrew is a former soldier with the Grenadier Guards who served in Afghanistan from March to September 2012. He is from Warwickshire and is a lifelong Aston Villa fan. He married his American wife Wanda in December 2011 and they have a 2-year old daughter who have been refused entry to the UK because of his low income.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
Feeling half a person is an understatement, this feeling never leaves you, from puberty to adulthood.
The Child's right to know should take priority over the mothers right to withhold, after all the child had no say in whether it wanted to be born. Women I feel, do not realise how very cruel withholding this information can be and I should know I have to live with this torment day in and day out.
I know Human rights are banded about these days, but I really do feel my Human rights have been trampled on.
A Father has a responsibility to support a child so his name should be on a birth certificate and in the case of a rape, this information should be available to the child at the age of 18.
Please government do the right thing and legislate!

attributes.action: Legislate to give MPs the sole right to elect party leaders
attributes.background: Current Conservative and Labour Party rules leave the final choice of party leaders exclusively in the hands of party members. This is neither fair nor democratic. Party members do not represent the full spectrum of the electorate supporting their party at the polls, unlike elected MPs.
attributes.additional_details:
This risks the selection of leaders at the polar ends of their respective parties because party members do not represent the middle ground occupied by most voters. The recent leadership tribulations of both main parties illustrate this only too well. 
Legislation should be introduced in support of representational democracy to make it compulsory for all parties with more than 49 sitting MPs to give their MPs the sole responsibility for electing their leader

attributes.action: Change the upgrading process for motorcycle licenses.
attributes.background:
On 19th January 2013 the motorcycle licence restrictions changed for new motorcycle riders. 

This meant that in order to upgrade from an A2 motorcycle license to an A motorcycle license requires the rider to pass the exact same test that they passed two years prior on an arbitrarily smaller bike.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst the tiered licensing system has its merits, and rightfully deserves to stay, a rethink on the upgrading process for riders must be considered.

If the automatic upgrade that was in place before the 2013 update is not satisfactory, perhaps some type of competency test on a larger motorcycle could be implemented, to ensure the rider's skills are still satisfactory - an advanced version of the CBT for riders with existing qualifications who wish to advance through their licenses.

attributes.action: stop the WPD from making radical changes to existing final salary schemes
attributes.background: All existing final salary schemes were signed  by the individual and the company after full explanation of the contents and should be legally binding .They should not be able to be manipulated by Ministers or the Work and Pensions department years later .

attributes.action: Replace religious education in UK schools with a comparative history of religion
attributes.background: Religion can be the cause of social and educational schism.
attributes.additional_details: School is our first experience of institutional life and so, as a priority, it should be inclusive and harmonised from the outset. Religion is used in our schools as a context to teach ethics. A Comparative History of Religion will foster objectivity and tolerance, which are themselves virtuous. A Comparative History of Religion will produce an empirical lesson in social harmony that is psychologically wholesome, undeniable and therefore enduring.

attributes.action: Lower Child Support where no Staying Contact, unless Child Protection issues.
attributes.background: Welfare Benefit Reforms mean the parent getting Child Benefit after separation can access the systems to get up to the income the law says they need.Child Support is not counted for means tested things, but more has to be paid if there is no Staying Contact, encouraging ex partners to try to stop it
attributes.additional_details: In the past 3 months there has been several cases on the Separated Dads Forum, where ex partners are opposing staying contact, just to get more Child Support. Some have even gone to the extent of false reports to Police/Social Services what then stopped contact for months, while investigation is ongoing. Children need both parents, and the no staying contact amount should only be paid in extreme cases due to Child Protection/Welfare. The starting amount should be based on 53-104 nights contact.

attributes.action: Put and end to UK circuses using animals as part of their 'performances'.
attributes.background: Along with you I feel it is extremely necessary to put an end to the abusive, cruel and unorthodox ways in which animals are treated in order to 'perform' to an audience. Awareness for this issue is preposterously inadequate and a lot more action against this compulsory to make a difference.
attributes.additional_details:
One case study to get a taste of the happens that are kept away from the public is Anne the elephant: 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1370050/Britains-circus-elephant-Anne-Battered-kicked-stabbed.html 

These animals are put through a life of pain for a number of hours worth of entertainment, surely everybody can see the imbalance in this.

attributes.action: Make it a regulation that support staff have a decent bed when on sleep ins
attributes.background:
I have worked in the care sector for years now and have a spinal disc hernia and arthritis in my back.
This I'm sure is caused by unsuitable cheap beds that support staff sleep on several times a week, care staff are known to have back problems in later life cheap beds are a huge contribution.

attributes.action: New floating national bank holiday in summer linked to hottest, sunniest day
attributes.background: There exists a need for a new national bank holiday between May and August. We propose new no fixed date, merely a floating day linked to the hottest / sunniest day of the year. That way everyone could have today off in the sunshine! This serves as a positive moral boost over unguaranteed weekends
attributes.additional_details: There are precedents of floating days such as Royal events or public mourning. This should be seen as an equal floating day but with a much more positive morale boost for the nation.

attributes.action: If the average temperature of the UK reaches 30ºC, a bank holiday is  declared.
attributes.background: This year it has taken until the 19th July for summer to arrive and for the temperature to surpass 30ºC, the hard working British people deserve better than having to commute and work on such a nice day. We have some of the greatest parks in the world we should use them more.
attributes.additional_details: We already have the least amount of bank holidays in the UK compared to the rest of Europe. (Germany has 13). It is a good excuse for society to come together and enjoy what seems to be last unifying British activity of frolicking in the sun.

attributes.action: Put The Open Golf Championship back on free to air TV
attributes.background: This is the first time in 60 years The Open as not been broadcast on free to air TV. Signing the petition will help influence the government to make The Open Championship a group A protected listed sporting event. Live coverage of the event will then be offered to free to air broadcasters.
attributes.additional_details: The Open Championship dates back to 1860 and is the the world's most prestigious golf tournament and one of four golf majors. With the an international field of the world's best golfers competing for the top prize in golf. The coverage of The Open as been enjoyed by millions on the BBC for the last 60 years, inspiring viewers of all ages to go out and play golf. As a nation we should be proud to host this event and it should be celebrated as one of the great British sporting events.

attributes.action: Change policy "reducing drugs & misuse & dependence" for Fibromyalgia sufferers.
attributes.background:
it is trying to reduce the misuse of prescription drugs.
However , due to the stigma associated with Fibromyalgia & M.E, by some in the medical profession and the fact we are living with an invisible illness I feel many people living with Fibro & M.E are wrongly assumed to be misusing medication.
attributes.additional_details: I have gone from working hard all my life and never taking from the system to a person in agony most days, I need help with dressing, can't cook, can't drive, as a consequence of the pain all over my body I have become very depressed and fear for my future. I am no longer able to work and I am about to go on zero wages and will have to retire due to being too ill. I am 47. The only thing that helps me is my  medication which has taken 6 months to get right, but I now have to beg for weekly.

attributes.action: Allow first time home buyers to pay stamp duty in installments.
attributes.background: Stamp duty for first time buyers makes buying a new home prohibitive for many. The government should allow first time buyers to pay it installments, rather than having to pay it up front.
attributes.additional_details: Buying a new home is extremely difficult due to the enormous up front cost of the deposit. Even with the governmental schemes to help prospective new home owners stamp duty still poses a major hurdle to every first time home buyer. Allow them to pay it in installments.

attributes.action: Ban Fixed Odds Betting Terminals
attributes.background:
Following the Gambling Act of 2005, Fixed Odds Betting Terminals are a feature in bookmakers' shops on our high streets.
Government should  give Councils powers to ban them from the high street
attributes.additional_details:
FOBTs are called the "crack cocaine" of gambling.
Users can lose hundreds of pounds in only a few minutes and can turn violent when this happens.
FOBTs destroy lives and families.
Government should act to ban them from our high streets.

attributes.action: Hygiene Facilities in Educational Institutes for our Children
attributes.background: As a grandmother, I struggle at times as my grandchild comes home with her underwear unclean and parents and carers like me would like our children coming home clean and it would be easier for measures to put in place for hygiene purposes.

attributes.action: Redistribute 8 Billion saving from EU to areas with the highest unemployment.
attributes.background: If, we are to leave the EU, and the amount saved is 8 billion pounds. This money should not be swallowed up by tax cuts. It should go to alleviating poverty, in the areas that need it most.

attributes.action: Change UK Prostitution Laws to be in line with Norway, Sweden, Ireland, France.
attributes.background: The laws around prostitution in the UK are inefficient. Decriminalisation zones are proven to be ineffective, as demonstrated by the murder of Daria Pionko that took place in Leeds, December 2015. Laws around prostitution are in urgent need of reform to ensure this industry doesn't continue to grow.
attributes.additional_details:
Signatories recommend:
- The prostituted be absolved of all criminality
- Investment is made in supporting prostituted persons to exit the sex trade via specialised training, support & health services
- Those at risk of entering prostitution are identified & supported to ensure they have viable career & education options
- The purchase of sexual access to human bodies is criminalised & subject to custodial penalty
- Consultation with Survivor Organisations is undertaken to inform legislation

attributes.action: Make it illegal to conduct racially insulting political campaign
attributes.background: It has become very common for politicians running for offices and campaigns lying and run racially insulting campaigns. Request the parliament to make it illegal to run such campaigns filled with lies and racial hatred
attributes.additional_details: The European Union referendum and the following Leaders elections have become very dirty. Many times the opponents blaming wrongly each other supporting certain religions. Using religion hatred is illegal in UK already, but no one is questioning the politicians when they are inciting the racial hatred. Request the parliamentarians to discuss this in the parliament and make laws to make racially motivated smear campaigns as illegal.
